lines.text: We'll take in a few clean-cut boys from good families, and if we can't make you fighters into gentlemen, we'll try to make some gentlemen into fighters.

...you know there really aren't two sides of the tracks to San Francisco. There's only the lucky and the unlucky, those that happened to grab the right moment and those that didn't, and don't you let this Nob Hill crowd deceive you either. After all, we all started out with the same wooden washtubs.
Well, Miss Ware, if I get knocked out, I hope you'll throw a little water on me.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: When you get knocked out, Mr. Corbett, I'll throw some champagne on you.
Yeah, uh, well, make sure it's good champagne.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: Do you see that hand?

[In unison]
Yes.

[In unison]
Yes.

[In unison]
Yes.
Well, you're gazin' on the hand that shook the hand of John L. Sullivan!
John L. Sullivan?
John L. Sullivan?
John Sullivan?

[Emphasizing the middle initial]
John L. Sullivan!
Well, what are you planning to do with it?
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: Well, I'm not even gonna wash it!
I've seen you around San Francisco a few times but from a long distance, of course.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: Well, seein' me from a long distance is a smart idea, young fella.

The first time I saw you fight I was just a bit of a kid. There wasn't a man alive who could have stood up to you then. And tonight, well, I was just mighty glad that you weren't the John L. Sullivan of ten years ago.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: Is that what you're thinkin' now?
That's what I was thinking before I got into the ring with you.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: That's a fine decent thing for you to say, Jim. I don't knopw how we might have come out, oh, say, eight or ten tears ago. I... maybe I was faster then, but if I was, tonight you're the fastest thing on two feet

[Looking at an enormously oversized derby he has been given by Victoria as a joke]
Well, it wouldn't take many of these to make a dozen. How'd you guess my size?
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: You're thinking about Sullivan?

Yeah. I can see him now walking back to his room, alone, lying there all night and thinking, 'What's the use of ever getting up again?' John L! He'll never thump another bar and shout, 'I can lick any man in the world.' He must be lost.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text:
[after being kissed by Corbett]
Fine way for a gentleman to behave.
Oh, darling, that gentleman stuff never fooled you, did it? I'm no gentleman.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: In that case, I'm no lady.
[they kiss again]
[repeated line]
The Corbetts are at it again! The Corbetts are at it again!

[to Victoria Ware]
That's the girl! You just keep pulling for me to lose, will you? That's the way I like it! Bring me good luck!
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text:
[Watching his inebriated father's weaving walk home]
Here comes Pop! Uh, he's walkin' the tightrope again.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: If I get lost, I'll send up a rocket.
lines.character: James J. Corbett aka Gentleman Jim

lines.text: It wouldn't surprise me.
